result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackarion Kellar Laronge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM Defendant Zackarion Kellar Laronge in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Zackarion Kellar Laronge.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites the agreement, all parties agree. DEF enters NC plea. State comments on the Restitution paid in CoC. Court reviews the Restitution. Court acknowledges that the DEF knowingly, willingly, and intellectually has given his plea. DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty. Court to follow agreement. 

COURT: Directs payment of Restitution to be paid to the LCO Country Store. Amend Count 1 to County Ordinance 1-1-1.4: Damage to Property. Fine/Costs - $330.50. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

11:37 AM Defendant Zackarion Kellar Laronge in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Zackarion Kellar Laronge.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Def Atty asks for a reset. Both parties agree. The bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Thomas- Schmidt requests reset.  Court resets STC to 8/30/22 at 11AM.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
